013package org.apache.juneau.serializer;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.IOUtils.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.nio.charset.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
024
025/**
026 * A wrapper around an object that a serializer sends its output to.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * For character-based serializers, the output object can be any of the following:
030 * <ul>
031 *    <li>{@link Writer}
032 *    <li>{@link OutputStream} - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
033 *    <li>{@link File} - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
034 *    <li>{@link StringBuilder}
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * For stream-based serializers, the output object can be any of the following:
039 * <ul>
040 *    <li>{@link OutputStream}
041 *    <li>{@link File}
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <ul class='seealso'>
045 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
046 * </ul>
047 */
048public final class SerializerPipe implements Closeable {
049
050   private final Object output;
051   private final boolean autoClose;
052
053   private OutputStream outputStream;
054   private Writer writer;
055   private Charset charset;
056
057   /**
058    * Writer-based constructor.
059    *
060    * @param output The object to pipe the serializer output to.
061    */
062   SerializerPipe(Object output, Charset streamCharset, Charset fileCharset) {
063      boolean isFile = (output instanceof File);
064      this.output = output;
065      this.autoClose = isFile;
066      Charset cs = isFile ? fileCharset : streamCharset;
067      if (cs == null)
068         cs = isFile ? Charset.defaultCharset() : UTF8;
069      this.charset = cs;
070   }
071
072   /**
073    * Stream-based constructor.
074    *
075    * @param output The object to pipe the serializer output to.
076    */
077   SerializerPipe(Object output) {
078      this.output = output;
079      this.autoClose = false;
080      this.charset = null;
081   }
082
083   /**
084    * Wraps the specified output object inside an output stream.
085    *
086    * <p>
087    * Subclasses can override this method to implement their own specialized output streams.
088    *
089    * <p>
090    * This method can be used if the output object is any of the following class types:
091    * <ul>
092    *    <li>{@link OutputStream}
093    *    <li>{@link File}
094    * </ul>
095    *
096    * @return
097    *    The output object wrapped in an output stream.
098    *    Calling {@link OutputStream#close()} on the returned object simply flushes the response and does not close
099    *    the underlying stream.
100    * @throws IOException If object could not be converted to an output stream.
101    */
102   public OutputStream getOutputStream() throws IOException {
103      if (output == null)
104         throw new IOException("Output cannot be null.");
105
106      if (output instanceof OutputStream)
107         outputStream = (OutputStream)output;
108      else if (output instanceof File)
109         outputStream = new BufferedOutputStream(new FileOutputStream((File)output));
110      else
111         throw new IOException("Cannot convert object of type "+className(output)+" to an OutputStream.");
112
113      return new NoCloseOutputStream(outputStream);
114   }
115
116
117   /**
118    * Wraps the specified output object inside a writer.
119    *
120    * <p>
121    * Subclasses can override this method to implement their own specialized writers.
122    *
123    * <p>
124    * This method can be used if the output object is any of the following class types:
125    * <ul>
126    *    <li>{@link Writer}
127    *    <li>{@link OutputStream} - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
128    *    <li>{@link File} - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
129    * </ul>
130    *
131    * @return
132    *    The output object wrapped in a writer.
133    *    Calling {@link Writer#close()} on the returned object simply flushes the response and does not close
134    *    the underlying writer.
135    * @throws SerializeException If object could not be converted to a writer.
136    */
137   public Writer getWriter() throws SerializeException {
138      if (output == null)
139         throw new SerializeException("Output cannot be null.");
140
141      try {
142         if (output instanceof Writer)
143            writer = (Writer)output;
144         else if (output instanceof OutputStream)
145            writer = new OutputStreamWriter((OutputStream)output, charset);
146         else if (output instanceof File)
147            writer = new OutputStreamWriter(new BufferedOutputStream(new FileOutputStream((File)output)));
148         else if (output instanceof StringBuilder)
149            writer = new StringBuilderWriter((StringBuilder)output);
150         else
151            throw new SerializeException("Cannot convert object of type "+className(output)+" to a Writer.");
152      } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
153         throw cast(SerializeException.class, e);
154      }
155
156      return new NoCloseWriter(writer);
157   }
158
159   /**
160    * Overwrites the writer in this pipe.
161    *
162    * <p>
163    * Used when wrapping the writer returned by {@link #getWriter()} so that the wrapped writer will be flushed
164    * and closed when {@link #close()} is called.
165    *
166    * @param writer The wrapped writer.
167    */
168   public void setWriter(Writer writer) {
169      this.writer = writer;
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * Overwrites the output stream in this pipe.
174    *
175    * <p>
176    * Used when wrapping the stream returned by {@link #getOutputStream()} so that the wrapped stream will be flushed
177    * when {@link #close()} is called.
178    *
179    * @param outputStream The wrapped stream.
180    */
181   public void setOutputStream(OutputStream outputStream) {
182      this.outputStream = outputStream;
183   }
184
185   /**
186    * Returns the raw output object passed into this session.
187    *
188    * @return The raw output object passed into this session.
189    */
190   public Object getRawOutput() {
191      return output;
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Closes the output pipe.
196    */
197   @Override /* Closeable */
198   public void close() {
199      try {
200         IOUtils.flush(writer, outputStream);
201         if (autoClose)
202            IOUtils.close(writer, outputStream);
203      } catch (IOException e) {
204         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
205      }
206   }
207}
